page.title: 05St.Albans Stallholder's Day.
page.content: {6.ooam Wednesday,}I collect the { {goods }and drive the trailer to St.Albans.Friends with fruit and veg. stalls rose earlier to buy fresh produce from a wholesaler.I {register {my stall by 8.30am}for if I am one minute late I can't sell my wares that day and I might be banned altogether. The blue & yellow canopies are in position as I {spread my wares on the {same spot}I've had for 40 years.The {sunny }weather attracts many { {customers,}some regular,some casual, from {St.Albans & district. On wet days customers are few and takings are low.I like the bustle, meeting people and working in the open. All day rubbish builds up and is collected regularly by the dust carts. {By 4.30pm I pack up}because we can't sell our wares after 5.00pm and return home.
